<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Examines reduction operations to see if the target can use a cheaper</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// operation with a wider per-iteration input VF and narrower PHI VF.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Each element within Chains is a pair with a struct containing reduction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// information and the scaling factor between the number of elements in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the input and output.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Recursively calls itself to identify chained scaled reductions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Returns true if this invocation added an entry to Chains, otherwise false.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// i.e. returns false in the case that a subcall adds an entry to Chains,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// but the top-level call does not.</span></CodeLine>
